{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pharyngeal arches are embryonic structures that give rise to various muscles and structures in the head and neck. The muscles derived from the pharyngeal arches include the muscles of mastication (temporalis, masseter, medial and lateral pterygoids), muscles of facial expression (including orbicularis oculi), muscles of the pharynx, larynx, and soft palate. A. Tensor tympani is derived from the first pharyngeal arch. B. Levator palpebrae superioris is derived from the first pharyngeal arch. C. Palatine tensor is derived from the first pharyngeal arch. D. Orbicularis oculi is derived from the second pharyngeal arch. Based on this information, the correct answer is D. Orbicularis oculi.", "answer_choice": "D"}
